profile.fitness_history: I've been doing strength training for the past 4 years, but I have had to take a break due to travelling and scheduling issues for the past 3 months. However, I have started to get back into it. My usual split was push, pull, legs (quad focus), legs (glutes and hamstrings focus). I have had knee pain in the past which has caused me to not be able to run, but I did one 3km run recently and while it did hurt it was better. I have had very little cardio in my routine, so I am looking to include this more. I don't own a bike, spinning is quite far from my house so running seems to be the best option. For stretching I have not been very good with this in the past but I know it's super important. I have tried yin yoga a couple of times and I loved it.
profile.primary_goal: Run 10km while being safe with my knee, Increase flexibility and Gain strength

preferences.cardio: Running is easiest most weeks, or anything needing gym equipment (so rowing for example)
preferences.strength: I like splitting by muscle groups, so push pull legs or if I cannot get many workouts in then I would do lower body and upper body
preferences.flexibility: Love yin yoga, need to increase overall mobility, any stretches that could help my knee with running would be good.
preferences.dislikes: Nothing that requires too much time like swimming, and I don't want to buy new equipment - e.g. I don't have a bike.
